Charleston

My dear husband

	I have just finished drinking
I have just finished drinking my tea, have left Mamma & the girls & have come upstairs to write to you.  I would have
e upstairs to write to you.  I would have written yesterday, but I had been shopping from after breakfast unt
ut I had been shopping from after breakfast until 3 oclock & was so much fatigued that in the afterno
rnoon I was obliged to lie down, & in the evening Aunt Eliza & Aunt Hayne took tea with us.  I have been in King street all
za & Aunt Hayne took tea with us.  I have been in King street all of the morning, but as I rode I do not
, but as I rode I do not feel so much fatigued as yesterday.  I have bought a great many articles & priced al
s.  I have bought carpeting for the Drawing room $2. a yard & the dining room $1.40.  To make up I ha
or the Drawing room $2. a yard & the dining room $1.40.  To make up I have gone without a chamber carpet

omorrow I intend to look at spoons, Mantel glass, Fenders, Andirons &c.  Shopping is very fatiguing.  Sometimes I am inclined to bu
y thinking can I afford this, can I afford that.  Shopping is pleasant when you have plenty of money, but no
at will interest you more.  You did not expect my first letter to you to be filled up with one subject, s
xpect my first letter to you to be filled up with one subject, shopping.  I will now write of you, myse
d have even more, if I had not been so engaged in King street.  Last night I thought sleep had forsaken
put me to sleep.  I hope it will not be the case tonight.  You must write to me often to make up for your
be doing well, so engaged as I am.  You recollect last year I was not so punctual, but I  love you more now,
y husband is great.  Your wife longs to see you.  The Diamond Rings are finished, & are very pretty.  Susan & Ann are
e Diamond Rings are finished, & are very pretty.  Susan & Ann are delighted with them.  I think they are pretti
ed with them.  I think they are prettier than the one you first gave me.  It is a nice guard to my wedd
them.  I think they are prettier than the one you first gave me.  It is a nice guard to my wedding ring.

isappointed.  Believe me, your affectionate wife, E.F.P.
